strings.Value: [Open the cage and free the owlbear]
[Lock the cage securely to prevent the owlbear from escaping]
[Try to quietly kill the caged owlbear]
[Step away from the cage] "This owlbear will help us fight the Stag Lord."
{n}The caged owlbear seems to be worried. He growls softly as you approach. It looks strong enough to break the cage's door.{/n}

{n}The owlbear seems to have endured some sort of abuse recently — probably at the hands of a certain druid. It's scared, angry, and wants to take revenge on his offenders. It seems to understand that you're not one of them, and it probably won't attack you.{/n}
{n}The owlbear is angry — that's about all you can understand.{/n}
{n}Your efforts don't seem to have accomplished anything — the cage door still looks like it would be easy to open.{/n}
{n}You wait until the owlbear looks away, then kill it with one quick blow.{/n}
{n}You accomplish your goal, but the owlbear gives a long, roaring scream before it dies.{/n}
{n}The cage is locked securely. The owlbear looks at you sadly from the corner of the cage.{/n}
